pr_title: Fix the incorrect hostname of proxy server in connection auto retry testsuite

timeline.message:
Fix hostname when connecting to proxy and postgres

PgConnectionAutoRetryTest connects to the proxy using the
hostname returned by ContainerPgRule.
This differs from `localhost` in some CI environments, see #854 and
https://www.testcontainers.org/features/networking/#getting-the-container-host
This needs to be changed to `localhost`, the proxy hostname,
to make the tests succeed.

ConnectionAutoRetryTestBase connects to the database using
`localhost` as hostname. The hostname of the database differs
from `localhost` in some CI environments.
Use the hostname returned by ContainerPgRule to make the tests succeed.

Fixes #854

Signed-off-by: Julian Ladisch <julianladisch@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: can you update other auto retry tests(they all extends ConnectionAutoRetryTestBase) in this project as well?
timeline.author: BillyYccc

replies.bodyText: The proxy server listening on a default host also seems not reliable for the testing, can we try to get rid of it and use the database host instead?
replies.author: BillyYccc

replies.bodyText:
The proxy server uses this.netServer.listen(), this is listening on default host = "0.0.0.0" = all interfaces.
I don't see how this could be unreliable.
Vert.x always starts a NetServer on localhost. For starting a server running at some other address we need Docker to create that server on a docker network. This is a different feature and should be tested in a different test, not in the connection auto retry test.
